content.heading: React
content.description: I've developed almost exclusively with React for my projects (including this site!). In my first co-op I worked with React, resolving bugs and creating components for the application.

content.heading: Tailwind, Material-UI
content.description: I enjoy using Tailwind CSS for my projects to save time, and will use Material-UI for quick projects that use many basic UI components.

content.heading: Express
content.description: I was introduced to ExpressJS at my first co-op. Since then I've worked on a few small projects to get familiar with it.

content.heading: Flask
content.description: I mainly use Flask for hackathons because it's easy to set up and most team members are familiar with Python.

content.heading: PostgreSQL
content.description: I was introduced to Postgres at my first co-op as well. I've used it in a few projects to get familiar with it.

content.heading: Django
content.description: The first web apps I built were with Django because it's a full stack framework. Now I'll use it for faster setups, like at hackathons.

content.heading: Git
content.description: I use git for work and hackathons where I'm working in a team on different aspects of the codebase.

content.heading: VS Code
content.description: VS Code is my IDE of choice for any and every project.

content.heading: Figma
content.description: I use Figma for my projects (including this site!) to mockup designs and make smarter UI/UX decisions.
